thread.title: $131M in lobbying to push Cuomo, state lawmakers in 2015
thread.title_full: $131M in lobbying to push Cuomo, state lawmakers in 2015 - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: $131M in lobbying to push Cuomo, state lawmakers in 2015
text:
James Keivom/New York Daily News Lobbying groups spent big money in the first six months of 2015 to influence Gov. Cuomo. ALBANY — Nearly $131 million was spent trying to influence Gov. Cuomo and state lawmakers during the first half of 2015, a new report revealed.
The $130.9 million spent on lobbying from January through June marked a $21.1 million increase from the same period in 2014, the Joint Commission on Public Ethics said in its mid-year report Thursday.
Heated battles over a proposed education tax credit, charter schools and real estate abatements, helped drive up spending, JCOPE reported.
CUOMO GIVES IMMIGRATION SPEECH AT 'HAMILTON' FUNDRAISER
The biggest spender was the Coalition for Opportunity in Education, which spent $5 million in an unsuccessful push for the adoption of a tax credit for individuals who give money to educational institutions.
"We're just leveling a playing field that's been dominated by one side of the education argument for decades,” said Robert Bellafiore, a spokesman for the group.
New York State United Teachers, which opposed the tax credit, was second on the spending list with $3.8 million spent on lobbying.
